title: 112_hr3205
content: The Act titled "FDA Renewing Efficiency From Outside Reviewer Management Act of 2011" allows accredited persons to review reports under 510(k) and make recommendations for initial classification. The Act "FDA Renewing Efficiency From Outside Reviewer Management Act of 2011" amends the time period for review of recommendations by accredited persons under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. The Secretary must make a determination within 30 days of receiving a recommendation regarding a report submitted under section 510(k) or an initial classification of a device. The Act amends the time period for review of recommendations by accredited persons under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. The Secretary must make a determination within 30 days of receiving a recommendation regarding a report submitted under section 510(k) or an initial classification of a device. The Secretary is required to regularly publish detailed decision summaries for each clearance of a device under section 510(k). The Act amends the review process for device clearances and classifications under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. An accredited person may review reports submitted under section 510(k), with the Secretary required to make determinations within 30 days. Total product life cycle information for devices is also included in the review process. The Act allows accredited persons to review reports for class II devices intended for permanent implantation or life support, with a notification required before the review. Accredited persons can review reports for class II devices intended for permanent implantation or life support after notifying the Secretary. If the Secretary does not object within 60 days, the accredited person is allowed to proceed. If there is an objection, the Secretary must provide written reasons for the objection. The Cosmetic Act is amended to include provisions for initial training and periodic updating of training for accredited persons reviewing reports for class II devices. Periodic reaccreditation is also required. The Cosmetic Act now requires periodic reaccreditation for accredited persons reviewing reports for class II devices. Accreditation is valid for 3 years, and the Secretary must respond to reaccreditation requests within 60 days. Criteria for reaccreditation will be established within 120 days of the enactment of this provision. The reaccreditation process for persons reviewing reports for class II devices is outlined in the Cosmetic Act. Accreditation is valid for 3 years, and specific activities for reaccreditation are specified. Changes in the reaccreditation process include criteria for sole practitioners, specifying the type of devices for accreditation, and clarifying the type of devices for which accreditation is granted. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to update the duration of authority and reporting deadlines. The Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to update the duration of authority and reporting deadlines for persons accredited to conduct inspections. Section 704(g)(11) is amended to change the date from October 1, 2012, to October 1, 2017.
